summary: Cú Chulainn is an Irish hero and demigod, believed to be the incarnation of the god Lugh. Born as Sétanta, he earned his name by slaying a fierce hound and taking its place as a guard. He was trained by Scáthach and given a powerful spear. Known for his fierce battle frenzy, he defended Ulster at age 17 in the famous Cattle Raid of Cooley. Cú Chulainn's wife was Emer, and he had a tragic son, Connla. He died in battle, standing tall by binding himself to a stone.
title: Cú Chulainn
